climbs.name: Quid Pro Quo (sit) AKA Squid Row Row

content.description:
The low low start to Quid Pro Quo. Left hand is the same compressing a tiny knob and right hand on a 1/2 pad crimp (same crimp used for a toe hook later on.)

The sit adds about 3 hand moves into the stand, and  a few foot moves (giving the grade.) Left hand slaps then bumps to a good pinch. Right hand to either the RH start hold or a incut side pull. From here you enter the original line.
Compression moves through slopers and the arete lead to the crux of nabbing a thin crimp on the otherwise blank face. A pounce to a jug on the lip sets up the easier but delicate finish.
content.protection: 2 or 3 pads. Spotter and a worried dog help too.
content.location: On the mostly sunny SW face. Start laying under and hugging the prow, left hand crimp undercling, right hand perfect slopy pinch/sidepull. Find feet to slap left hand to the arete. Right hand/heel match to take the sloping horizontal rail, left hand bumps higher. Flip hips for a high left foot on the arete. Squeeze until you locate the blind right toe hook and can reach the crimp. Set up for a pounce to the jug then wide right to a good sidepull crimp. A few moves using the arete and face to the right for the top.

content.description: Start sitting, left hand big rail, right hand low on the arete. Right hand to crimp, left hand to sidepull. Set up for a reachy left hand to a bulbous pinch/sidepull. Right hand slaps on the arete, then to a good right facing rail on the slab. High feet to a move or two on slab to reach the juggy top.
content.location: NW side of boulder. Problem facing you as approached from Patriot Crack.
